Source   Edit  

Module for editing pattern data.

Imports

common, data

Types

ColumnIter = object
  columnStart*, columnEnd*: TrackSelect
Iterator object for iterating the selectable columns within a track. Source   Edit   
PatternAnchor = PatternCursorBase[TrackSelect]
Similar to a PatternCursor but differs in that its column member is a TrackSelect instead of TrackColumn. An anchor is used for specifying a boundary corner of a pattern selection. Source   Edit   
PatternClip = object
A partial copy of pattern data that can be pasted elsewhere. Source   Edit   
PatternCursor = PatternCursorBase[TrackColumn]
Object representating a cursor's position in a pattern. Source   Edit   
PatternIter = PatternSelection
Iterator object for iterating through a selection. Note this is the same type as a pattern selection, but will have its corners normalized for easy iteration. Source   Edit   
PatternSelection = object
A selection within a pattern. The region is determined from two corner anchors, which can be either top-left + bottom-right or top-right + bottom-left in any order. A normalized selection has the first corner top-left and the second bottom-right. Source   Edit   
TrackColumn = enum
  colNote,                  ## The note
  colInstrumentHi,          ## The high-nibble of instrument
  colInstrumentLo,          ## The low-nibble of instrument
  colEffectType1,           ## The effect type byte for effect no 1
  colEffectParamHi1,        ## The high-nibble of effect param for effect no 1
  colEffectParamLo1,        ## The low-nibble of effect param for effect no 1
  colEffectType2,           ## The effect type byte for effect no 2
  colEffectParamHi2,        ## The high-nibble of effect param for effect no 2
  colEffectParamLo2,        ## The low-nibble of effect param for effect no 2
  colEffectType3,           ## The effect type byte for effect no 3 
  colEffectParamHi3,        ## The high-nibble of effect param for effect no 3
  colEffectParamLo3          ## The low-nibble of effect param for effect no 3
Enum of columns within a track Source   Edit   
TrackSelect = enum
  selNote,                  ## The note
  selInstrument,            ## The instrument
  selEffect1,               ## Effect no 1
  selEffect2,               ## Effect no 2
  selEffect3                 ## Effect no 3
Enum of columns within a track that can be selected. Source   Edit

proc moveTo(s: var PatternSelection; pos: PatternAnchor) {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Adjust the selection such that an anchor, pos, is contained within it. The selection is kept as is if pos is already contained. Source   Edit   
proc paste(c: PatternClip; song: var Song; order: ByteIndex; pos: PatternCursor;
           mix = false) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Pastes or copies the clip's stored data into a song's pattern. order is the index in the song order of the pattern to paste into. pos is the position to insert the data at. When mix is true, the clipped data will be mixed in with the source data, where only the empty columns in the source are overwritten with the clip data. When mix is false, overwrite paste is used, which simply overwrites the source pattern's data with the clip's data. Source   Edit   
proc restore(c: PatternClip; song: var Song; order: ByteIndex) {....raises: [],
    tags: [], forbids: [].}
Restores previously clipped data at its original location. Source   Edit   
func rows(i: PatternIter): Slice[int] {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}
Convert a pattern iterator to a slice of rows Source   Edit   
proc save(c: var PatternClip; song: Song; order: ByteIndex;
          region: PatternSelection) {....raises: [], tags: [], forbids: [].}

Saves a portion of pattern data in the given song to a clip. The order is the index in the song order to use as the pattern data source. region is the location and amount of data to clip.

A RangeDefect will be raised if region is not a valid selection for a pattern in the song.

Source   Edit   
func selection(c: PatternClip): PatternSelection {....raises: [], tags: [],
    forbids: [].}
Gets the region of the clipped data as a pattern selection. Source   Edit
